Locations

Salta city and surroundings

The city of Salta was founded in 1582 and still today possesses a marked spanish appearance that distinguishes it from the rest of the cities in the country ad has turned it one of the provincial capital cities with a greater identities. This area, consisting of the towns of Salta,San Lorenzo, La Caldera and Vaqueros, offers the tourist different proposals such as: cultural tourism, horse-riding, bird-watching, mountain biking, and four-track riding, among others.

Book

Lerma Valley

This valley that extends all around te city of Salta, is characterized by its farming production -espeacially the tobacco cultivation- its gaucho traditions and the beautiful mountains surrounding it. This area consists of the towns of Campo Quijano, Chicoana, Coronel Moldes, Cerrillos, Rosario de Lerma, El Carril, Guachipas, La Viña and La Merced. The most outstanding tourism modalities and the rural tourism and the adventure tourism.

Book

Calchaquí valleys

This is one of the most beautiful and outstanding areas of the province due to its many attractions among its colourful mountains. It is an area that can be visited in a circular circuit that leaves from and arrives in the Capital City going through the towns of Molinos, Cachi, Cafayate, San Carlos, Seclantás, Animaná Angastaco, La Poma and Payogasta. The most outstanding forms of tourism are cultural tourism, adventure tourism, Eno tourism, rural community tourism, among others.

Book

Puna

This region, situated in the West limit of the province, at the foot of the Cordillera de los Andes, is a plateau located over 3,000 masl, integrated by the towns of Santa Rosa de Tastil, San Antonio de los Cobres and Tolar Grande. In this area you can practice activities of adventure tourism, mountain tourism, bird-watching, rural community tourism, and cultural tourism, among others.

Book

Historical and Gaucho south

Landscapes with rich historical content where you can find some important museums and monuments such as: Finca la Cruz Quebrada la Horqueta, Fuerte de Cobos, and Posta de Yatasto, places that were the scenarios of the heroic deeds of Güemes and the wars for the Independence of Argentina, integrated by the towns of Rosario de la Frontera, El Galpón, San José de Metán, El Bordo, General Güemes, General Pizarro, Joaquín V. González, Las Lajitas, La Candelaria, A. Saravia.

Book

Green North

The North of Salta is covered by a subtropical forest called Las Yungas, where the towns of Orán, Tartagal, General Mosconi, Embarcación, Los Toldos, Salvador Mazza, Pichanal, Urundel, Hipólito Irigoyen, Santa Victoria Este are located. The most outstanding forms of tourism are: photographic safaris, bird-watching, cultural tourism, adventure tourism, kayaking, canoeing and rafting.

Book

Andean North

Also in the North of Salta, but on the far western edge of the province where altitudes above sea level reach altitudes higher than 4,000 metres, the towns of Iruya, Santa Victoria Oeste and Nazareno are located; small towns that are characterized by their andean aspect. In this area tourists can carry out activities of adventure tourism, rural community tourism, cultural tourism, and bird-watching, among others.

Book
